block.p: Paula Jonelle Wenger, the daughter of Mary Wenger of Westport, Conn., and the late Maj. Gen. Don S. Wenger, was married yesterday to John Richard Conway, the son of Patricia Conway of Fredricksburg, Md., and John Robert Perrygo of Waldorf, Md. The Rev. Paul Z. Hoornstra, an Episcopal priest and a grandfather of the bride, performed the ceremony at St. Peter's Episcopal Church on Skidaway Island in Georgia.

Mrs. Conway, 30, is a publicist and an associate vice president at Rubenstein Associates, the public relations firm in New York. She graduated from New York University and received a master's degree in theatrical management and production from Columbia. Her mother is a freelance writer. The bride's father was an Air Force pilot and the military medical supervisor of NASA's first manned space flights.

Paula Jonelle Wenger, the daughter of Mary Wenger of Westport, Conn., and the late Maj. Gen. Don S. Wenger, was married yesterday to John Richard Conway, the son of Patricia Conway of Fredricksburg, Md., and John Robert Perrygo of Waldorf, Md. The Rev. Paul Z. Hoornstra, an Episcopal priest and a grandfather of the bride, performed the ceremony at St. Peter's Episcopal Church on Skidaway Island in Georgia.

Mrs. Conway, 30, is a publicist and an associate vice president at Rubenstein Associates, the public relations firm in New York. She graduated from New York University and received a master's degree in theatrical management and production from Columbia. Her mother is a freelance writer. The bride's father was an Air Force pilot and the military medical supervisor of NASA's first manned space flights.

Mr. Conway, also 30, adopted the surname of his maternal grandfather. He worked until recently as a staff lawyer in New York for Sanofi-Synthelabo, a French health care company. He graduated from Southern Methodist University and the University of Baltimore School of Law. He also holds a certificate in ancient and modern history from Oxford University in England. His father is the deputy director of housing for the Navy Facilities Engineering Command in Washington.
